summary: I am an Industrial design engineer that seeks to produce innovative solutions through technical driven problems. My expertise lies in applying new emerging technologies and production processes to create novel solutions for products and push design further to build a more sustainable future. With a skill set in Computer aided design, Adobe CC and sketching. I can provide a unique design flare that brings the design and mechanical engineering workplace into one.

projects.title: Marmite Package Redesign
projects.description:
A squeezable container concept was redesigned for marmite to improve the problems with the existing container. The redesigned container provides a better user experience to help the user get every last drop of Marmite with less effort. Marmite is a brand centered around nostalgia that is reinforced with its iconic bell jar that has not changed since the 1920s. Redesigning this new container so that it's more user-friendly yet still in line with Marmite’s brand identity was a fun challenge.

Along with this, the secondary and tertiary packaging was envisioned to create a promotional package for the new squeezable container along with two egg cups. The box utilizes Marmites high contrast colour palette. With minimal exterior detail and images, it is the Iconic colours that do all the talking.

projects.title: Filter Fountain
projects.description:
This project involved applying new emerging solar technologies into an application. For this group project a. Filter fountain was conceptualized. This is a solar powered filtration system for urban lakes. It is designed to monitor and control the nutrient levels helping prevent eutrophication which causes it to become unpleasant and harmful. The Filter fountain utilizes 32m2 of Luminescent solar concentrators found within the petals which will provide energy to power the filtration system, water fountain and motors used to move the petals during sunrise and sunset mimicking flowers in nature. 
 
For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

projects.title: Hourse Trailer Design for Love Shack Sound
projects.description:
Loveshacksound wanted their ideas to be brought to life in some rough concept sketches. They wanted to convert a horsebox trailer into both a mobile recording studio while having an optional performing setup for events and festivals. Through collaborative work sketches and plans were created to aid as a basis for talks and discussions with their contractors to make this idea a reality. 

For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

projects.title: VW Bus to Camper Conversion
projects.description:
I own a 1980’s VW T3 bus which was inherited from my grandad. The Bus is originally a 7 seater. However, I plan to convert it into a campervan to tour around Europe after I have graduated. To help progress this project a 3D CAD model of the interior was created including; wiring, utilities, electronic devices, and a Pop-Top. Along with the CAD model, component lists, scaled plans, and electronic circuit diagrams were created to create a fully off-grid setup.

For more information on the project check out the link to my Instagram.

projects.title: Rotate Sunglasses
projects.description:
The first examples of the hinge date back to 1600 BC and ever since has been a major aspect in the functionality of sunglasses. These small hinges in sunglasses are prone to failure and are a point of weakness when the hinge buckles and fails the sunglasses are nearly always irreparable. To solve this problem the Rotate sunglass concept was envisioned. This is a retro pair of sunglasses with a revolutionary hinge. The sunglasses work by a rotational mechanism at a 45 and 47-degree angle and clipped together by 2 neodymium magnets on either side holding the pivot together. With this new hinge the mechanism can never break, is always reliable, contains fewer components Increasing manufacturing efficiency, whilst being slick and invisible to the eye.

For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

projects.title: Bus Stop seat
projects.description:
When waiting for the bus especially in large cities is lack of space. The typical bus seat is designed to be lent on to address this issue. However, if you are an elderly person standing up for long durations of time is uncomfortable or dangerous for their health. The new innovative bus seat is designed to accommodate these elderly people whilst still optimizing the bus stop space.  

For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

projects.title: Matlab - Toy Train App
projects.description:
When growing up every child loves to be creative and build objects which is one of the reasons for the success of companies like Lego®. This creative drive can be put to great use in many children's toys, and one of the best is the toy train set. The toy train set allows the child to design their own train track arrangement and scenery layout through the use of simple wooden building block shapes, however, one of the downsides of these sets is that you are unable to design the toy train itself. 

The Toy Train Programme is designed to allow a child to design a new bespoke train easily, with a user-friendly interface. Once the child is happy with their toy they have created an STL file can be generated allowing the child to 3D print their train and within a few hours, the child has their own Toy Train to play with, which can be customised further with paint or simply added to their collection. 

The parameters of the train have been carefully chosen to ensure that the width, axle length and wheel thickness and minimum wheel diameter still match the working drawings for the dimensions of the Brio® Toy Train Track, thus allowing the toy train to work on existing wooden tracks. This lets the child invent with endless possibilities and combinations the child is able to choose, with no worries about compatibility.

projects.title: Shed build No.2
projects.description:
Having helped my Dad build a shed when I was 13, I decided to build one on my own, because a man can never have enough sheds. The shed built was 11ft x 7.5ft x 12ft .  The shed is a timber frame covered in shiplap, sat on a 2-course high brick wall. The roof also has a timber frame but with a full clay tiled roof with lead detailing and a Velux window.  All the roof materials were salvaged from our  old house when the roof was replaced and the whole shed cost less than £500.

For more information email: 10phepbu@gmail.com

projects.title: Transforming Park Bench
projects.description:
As part of my A'Level Project, I designed and built a Park Bench that transforms by using leavers and counterbalancing parts of the bench, this is achieved effortlessly. The bench can either be used as a double-sided seat or a picnic table. For this project, I received an A* and full marks.

For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

If you are interested and would like more information do not hesitate to email me: 10phepbu@gmail.com

projects.title: GO Kart restoration
projects.description:
I purchased a rusty go-kart from eBay for £125. It did not work and was covered in rust. The project entailed stripping the whole go-kart, rubbing down, painting, servicing the 337cc Honda GX 340 engine, repairing broken parts, sourcing a break from the local scrap yard etc. 

The go-kart now works very well and I have recently replaced the rear sprocket due to the previous one wearing out, along with purchasing a new brake. Due to the go-kart being bespoke all the parts sourced need to be altered making the project all the more interesting.  

For more information email: 10phepbu@gmail.com

projects.title: PHoton - Inspection light that Diminishes shadows
projects.description:
PHoton - Inspection light that diminishes shadows. Most inspection lights contain attachments or magnets on the backside, however, when working underneath a vehicle this means that the light points away from your work, resulting in lots of shadows. The PHoton concept solves this issue; by clever light placement, it can completely diminish shadows, improving user efficiency and safety. 

For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

projects.title: Roll Up chair
projects.description:
GCSE project A* (100%)- designed and built a fully working prototype of a chair that can be rolled up to 1/4 of its original volume and can also be transformed into a sun lounger. The chair contains a clever supporting system called the SLACC (Spring Loaded Adjustable Chair Cage) which supports the chair and provided an aid to carry the seat. 

For more information on the project check out the link to my instagram.

profile_positions.description:
Paid summer work experience working within the NCC. Working as part of the Liquid Composite Manufacturing team. The internship entailed redesigning their Manufacturing Cell layout to optimise manufacturing efficiency, by utilising upstairs and finding innovative solutions to common problems within Cell by exploring approaches in other manufacturing disciplines.  Along with pitching the layout concepts and solutions to the head of departments, workshop floor managers, technicians and other personnel using the Cell. To gain feedback and to get their buy-in for this investment.   

The work experience also entailed attending many training workshops offered by the NCC in composite manufacture and techniques to gain a real insight and hands-on learning into the potential and limitations of composite manufacturing processes.
